channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Greece seeks spear fisher who killed famous seal
item.description: Kostis, a rare Mediterranean monk seal rescued as a pup, is killed by a spear gun.

item.title: German lawyers wrangle over pensioner's WW2 tank in basement
item.description: The 84-year-old kept the vehicle in his basement, along with an anti-aircraft gun and a torpedo.

item.title: Nikola Tesla: Sparks fly over plans to honour inventor with coin
item.description: Both Croatia and Serbia claim Nikola Tesla, pioneer of alternating current electricity, as their hero.

item.title: Raphael Varane: Man Utd agree fee for Real Madrid defender
item.description: Manchester United agree a fee with Real Madrid for France international defender Raphael Varane.

item.title: Brexit: EU publishes proposals to simplify NI Protocol
item.description: The UK government says plans on the transport of medicines, food and animals do not go far enough.

item.title: Pink offers to pay bikini bottoms fine for Norway women's handball team
item.description: The Norway women's side were last week fined for wearing shorts instead of bikini bottoms in a match.

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: COP26 climate summit president says progress made, but not enough
item.description: The first in-person climate meeting in 18 months sees tentative progress, but not enough.

item.title: Could Covid vaccine be taken as a pill?
item.description: Researchers are looking at easier ways for people to get the vaccine, including via inhalers and tablets.

item.title: Canterbury Cathedral stained glass is among world's oldest
item.description: New research indicates that stained glass windows from Canterbury Cathedral may be among the oldest in the world.

item.title: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
item.description: The famous Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park are symbols of the Spanish capital's history.

item.title: Meteor wows Norway after blazing through night sky
item.description: The meteor is believed to have landed in a forest after flashes of light were seen across Norway.

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: I survived Norway's worst terror attack
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in 2011.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Horse racing: Inside the abattoir slaughtering racehorses
item.description: Campaign group Animal Aid set up covert cameras in one of the few slaughterhouses licensed to kill horses.
